4.4.1.title: Pipe Displacement
4.4.1.content:
**Definitions:**
- **Metal Displacement:** Volume of steel (displaces when pipe enters hole)
- **Closed-end Displacement:** Total volume of pipe (metal + internal)
- **Open-end Displacement:** Metal only (fluid inside remains)

**Metal Displacement:**
```
Displacement (bbl/ft) = (OD² - ID²) ÷ 1029.4
```

**Common Values:**
| Pipe | Metal Disp. |
|------|-------------|
| 5" DP (19.5 lb/ft) | 0.0076 bbl/ft |
| 5" HWDP | 0.0180 bbl/ft |
| 6.5" DC | 0.0295 bbl/ft |
| 8" DC | 0.0490 bbl/ft |

4.4.2.title: Trip Fill Calculations
4.4.2.content:
**When Pulling Pipe (POOH):**
```
Expected Fill = Pipe Displacement × Length Pulled
```

**Example:**
5" DP displacement = 0.0076 bbl/ft
Length pulled = 10 stands × 93 ft = 930 ft

Expected Fill = 0.0076 × 930 = 7.1 bbl

**Compare:**
- If hole takes LESS than expected: Possible influx (gain)
- If hole takes MORE than expected: Possible losses
- If hole takes expected: Normal

**Trip Sheet:**
Maintain trip sheet recording fill at regular intervals.

4.4.3.title: Swab and Surge
4.4.3.content:
**Swab (pulling pipe):**
Creates pressure reduction below pipe.
```
Swab Pressure = f(pull speed, mud properties, annular clearance)
```

**Surge (running pipe):**
Creates pressure increase below pipe.
```
Surge Pressure = f(run speed, mud properties, annular clearance)
```

**Factors:**
- Faster = more pressure change
- Thicker mud = more pressure change
- Tighter annulus = more pressure change

**Mitigation:**
- Control trip speed
- Optimize mud properties
- Use swab/surge models for planning
- Add trip margin to mud weight

4.4.4.title: Trip Margin
4.4.4.content:
**Definition:**
Additional mud weight above required balance to account for swab effects.

**Typical Values:**
- Normal operations: 0.2-0.3 ppg
- High swab risk: 0.3-0.5 ppg
- Very tight annulus: May need higher

**Calculation:**
Based on swab pressure prediction.
```
Trip Margin (ppg) = Predicted Swab (psi) ÷ 0.052 ÷ TVD
```

**Application:**
Maintain mud weight = Pore pressure EMW + Trip margin

4.4.5.title: Volume to Fill
4.4.5.content:
**Pipe Internal Volume:**
```
Pipe Volume (bbl/ft) = ID² ÷ 1029.4
```

**Common Values:**
| Pipe | Internal Cap. |
|------|---------------|
| 5" DP (4.276" ID) | 0.0178 bbl/ft |
| 6.5" DC (2.25" ID) | 0.0049 bbl/ft |
| 7" Casing | 0.0454 bbl/ft |

**Use:**
- Calculate volume to fill pipe when running
- Calculate volume inside string for kill calculations
